fields.Dialogue Text: "Not everyone is." He nods. "Most people are *young* and that. The rich man took everything from you, lumpenproletariat. Except your bottle..."

fields.Title: You: ""By the way, I have internalized hi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "By the way, I have internalized his *weltanschauung*."

fields.Title: Endurance: "Or maybe it's just his body and min..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Or maybe it's just his body and mind giving up on him, at last...

fields.Title: You: ""It was you. You shot the statue --..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It was you. You shot the statue -- there was a bullet hole in his heart..."

fields.Title: You: ""Yes, and furthermore -- the design..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, and furthermore -- the design bureau people are probably left wing too. They often are."

fields.Title: You: ""Of course. Straight to Yekokataa.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Of course. Straight to Yekokataa."

fields.Title: You: ""You're wrong. I'm no communard. I'..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You're wrong. I'm no communard. I'm a cop."

fields.Title: The Deserter: ""You can't live alone..." He's stop..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You can't live alone..." He's stopped poking at the ash now, just shakes his head.

fields.Title: The Deserter: ""Tried teaching him some Mazovian s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Tried teaching him some Mazovian socio-economics. They didn't stick. We parted ways." He coughs.

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "They let him be here. 'Understandin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: They let him be here. 'Understanding' was a courtesy -- but why such a courtesy?

fields.Title: You: ""Let's let this one slide.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Let's let this one slide."

fields.Title: You: ""Good, traditional Revacholian beat..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Good, traditional Revacholian beats. Not moronic at all."

fields.Title: You: ""Women do like their Barbara Muskov..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Women do like their Barbara Muskova and their Numb 12..."

fields.Title: The Deserter: ""No, I guess it was not..." You cou..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No, I guess it was not..." You could swear you see the embers glow again, under his eyes on the dust.

fields.Title: The Deserter: ""Or maybe she just fell. I get thes..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Or maybe she just fell. I get these violent ideations.... My memory is filled with holes, especially the Thirties. All I know is..."

fields.Title: The Deserter: ""I saw it happen and I liked it. Th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I saw it happen and I liked it. That's all I have to say. I didn't live and fight for forty years to end up as a collaborationist. I've heard it on Channel 8, 40AM, Radio Revachol Late Night..."

fields.Title: You: ""It was I who cleared them from the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It was I who cleared them from the ice."

fields.Title: The Deserter: ""I didn't live and fight for forty..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I didn't live and fight for forty years to end up as a collaborationist. I've heard it -- on Channel 8, 40AM *and* Radio Revachol Late Night..."

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "Slap yourself in your head again, j..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Slap yourself in your head again, jump start it!

fields.Title: Volition: "NOW!"
fields.Dialogue Text: NOW!

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""With Edgar. The death of the Krene..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "With Edgar. The death of the Krenel mercenary was only *coincidentally* beneficial to the Claires. But..."

fields.Title: Empathy: "He seems relieved. Could he have be..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He seems relieved. Could he have been worried for him?

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "They are veterans of the same war...."
fields.Dialogue Text: They are veterans of the same war. Somewhere west, in Coal City his enemy is lying in a dark room, on a metal slider. In L'Ossuaire Municipal, like he will too. Soon. Half of the war between these men is over.

fields.Title: Suggestion: "He reminds him of himself. The same..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He reminds him of himself. The same hatred. The same... you try to think of another thing -- but no, it's just the hatred.

fields.Title: Cuno: "Cuno squints into the distance, con..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Cuno squints into the distance, confused. "Walterschlong?" he whispers to himself.

fields.Title: Reaction Speed: "And the soucriant, on *her* yacht -..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And the soucriant, on *her* yacht -- Joyce? Probably...

fields.Title: Cuno: ""Yo, Cuno doesn't understand what's..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yo, Cuno doesn't understand what's goin' on here. Get a hold of it, detective Dick, let's move on, okay?"

fields.Title: The Deserter: ""I can't *believe* the inert lumpen..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I can't *believe* the inert lumpen out there. They just let her drive her little boat like that. No violence, not even a robbery. The working class has lost their appetite for justice..." His voice trails off in disappointment.

fields.Title: Logic: "If he really wanted to kill him so..."
fields.Dialogue Text: If he really wanted to kill him so bad, he would have done. There must have been a thousand *black days* on these islands, his health ailing.

fields.Title: You: "Dementia?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Dementia?

fields.Title: Empathy: "Great leaps of emotion: from anger..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Great leaps of emotion: from anger to grief, despair...

fields.Title: The Deserter: ""Your beloved *Joyce Messier*. A so..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Your beloved *Joyce Messier*. A soucriant. A blood sucker. Women like her *feed* on the life energy of young working class men. And they *let* her."

fields.Title: The Deserter: ""Yes, well..." the ancient communar..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, well..." the ancient communard sizes you both up, not sure what to think of it.

fields.Title: Perception (Sight): "You could say he has dirty fingerna..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You could say he has dirty fingernails, but that's just a fact, it's not going to do anything.

fields.Title: You: ""You'd like to kill him?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "You'd like to kill him?"

fields.Title: The Deserter: ""Yes, where is he?" he tenses up. "..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, where is he?" he tenses up. "I hope he doesn't have *debilitating* arthritis. Or kidney stones. He can still come out to play with balls and get shot in the head, right?"

fields.Title: You: ""René is dead. He died of old age,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "René is dead. He died of old age, a couple of days ago."

fields.Title: The Deserter: ""Heh, yes of course." He seems to r..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Heh, yes of course." He seems to relax a bit. "I hope it hurts like hell, I hope he sweats blood. Must be torture -- not to be throwing his balls for a *whole week*..."

fields.Title: Half Light: "The flame of anger dulls in him. He..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The flame of anger dulls in him. He tires of it, all of it...
